Name: Smallpox
Comments_and_citation: 1796 was first test but findings were published 2 years later. 1800 - Dr. Benjamin Waterhouse gives the smallpox vaccine to his son and other family members. These smallpox vaccinations are the first in the U.S.

Name: Rabies
Comments_and_citation: The first rabies vaccine was introduced in 1885 and was followed by an improved version in 1908.

Name: Diphtheria
Inventor: Emil von Behring or William Hallock Park
Comments_and_citation: Mixtures of diphtheria toxin and antitoxin https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-94-007-7624-1_1

Name: Tuberculosis
Comments_and_citation: BCG began being mass-produced by the Pasteur Institute in France in 1924 - see https://www.maedica.ro/articles/2013/1/2013_Vol8(11)_No1_pg53-58.pdf and https://www.pasteur.fr/en/home/research-journal/news/bcg-vaccine-first-tuberculosis-vaccination-took-place-century-ago

Name: Pertussis
Inventor: Pearl Kendrick, Grace Eldering, Loney Gordon

Name: Tick-borne encephalitis
Comments_and_citation: First TBE vaccine based on Sofyin strain of the TBE virus prepared from infected mouse brain and inactivated with formalin. Date refers to date of trials as public availability isnt mentioned https://academic.oup.com/jhmas/advance-article/doi/10.1093/jhmas/jrad054/7264135

Name: Influenza
Comments_and_citation: Bivalent A and B vaccine available to general population in US https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5139605/

Name: DTP
Inventor: Pearl Kendrick, Loney Gordon, Grace Eldering

Name: Tick-borne encephalitis
Inventor: M.P. Chumakov Institute of Poliomyelitis & Viral Encephalitides in Soviet Union
Comments_and_citation: Second TBE vaccine using cell cultures from chicken embryos. Date refers to date of trials as public availability isnt mentioned https://academic.oup.com/jhmas/advance-article/doi/10.1093/jhmas/jrad054/7264135 and https://siberes.ru/en/Six-Lectures/

Name: Adenovirus
Comments_and_citation: Adenovirus types 4 and 7 oral https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/nejmp2029466 Adenovirus vaccine is only available for United States military personnel.  There is currently no adenovirus vaccine available to the general public. https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/vis/vis-statements/adenovirus.html

Name: Tick-borne encephalitis
Inventor: James Keppie - Porton Down, Christian Kunz

Name: Rabies
Inventor: Ernst Kuwert, Hilary Koprowski et al.
Comments_and_citation: Human diploid cell vaccine https://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/nejmp2029466 and https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/1031689/

Name: DTaP-Hib
Comments_and_citation: Combines DTP and Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib). https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/00044501.htm

Name: HepA-HepB
Comments_and_citation: First introduced in Belgium in 1996. Combines Hepatitis A and Hepatitis B vaccines. https://www.ema.europa.eu/en/medicines/human/EPAR/twinrix-adult

Name: DTaP-IPV
Comments_and_citation: First licensed in Denmark in 1997. Combines Diphtheria, Tetanus, Pertussis, and Polio. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.vaccine.2013.08.034

Name: DTP-HepB-Hib-IPV
Comments_and_citation: Combines DTP, Hepatitis B, Hib, and Inactivated Polio Vaccine (IPV). https://www.ema.europa.eu/en/medicines/human/EPAR/infanrix-hexa

Name: DTP-HepB-Hib
Comments_and_citation: First introduced in 2001 in low-income countries through Gavi. Combines DTP, Hepatitis B, and Haemophilus influenzae type b (Hib). https://www.gavi.org/news/media-room/5-1-vaccine-now-all-73-poorest-countries

Name: Tdap-IPV
Comments_and_citation: First introduced in Europe - booster vaccine for adolescents and adults combining Tetanus, reduced-dose Diphtheria, Pertussis, and Polio. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.vaccine.2012.12.081

Name: DTaP-IPV-HepB
Comments_and_citation: First introduced in the U.S. in 2002. Combines DTP, Polio, and Hepatitis B. https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/mm5210a8.htm

Name: Influenza
Inventor: Hunein F. Maassab and Martin L. Bryant
Comments_and_citation: Intranasally administered live attenuated vaccine called FluMist https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10578119/

Name: MenACWY
Comments_and_citation: Meningococcal conjugate vaccine covering four strains (A, C, W, Y). https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/rr5407a1.htm

Name: MMRV
Comments_and_citation: Combines MMR with varicella (chickenpox) to reduce separate vaccinations. https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/rr5903a1.htm

Name: Rotavirus
Inventor: H Fred Clark, Stanley Plotkin et al. - GSK

Name: Human papillomavirus
Inventor: Ian Frazer and Jian Zhou - Merck

Name: Influenza
Comments_and_citation: A/H5N1 vaccine? in response to 2003-04 flu season in Asia

Name: Hepatitis
Comments_and_citation: Hepatitis E. Hecolin; first approved in China and then recommended by WHO https://www.who.int/groups/global-advisory-committee-on-vaccine-safety/topics/hepatitis-e-vaccines

Name: Dengue
Comments_and_citation: Dengvaxia became commercially available in 2016 first in 20 countries; approved in EU and US in 2018 and 2019 respectively

Name: Ebola
Comments_and_citation: Ebola Zaire. rVSV platform Ad26.ZEBOV and MVA-BN-Filo https://johnsonandjohnson.gcs-web.com/static-files/1c979f4f-cad3-4f8b-9a22-69aaac503570
